meanings.definition: A detached outwork in front of a fortification to protect it from an attack.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers stationed at the ravelin kept a watchful eye on the enemy's movements.
meanings.sent2: The construction of the ravelin added an extra layer of defense to the fort.
meanings.sent3: During the siege, the ravelin became the strategic hideout for the defenders to plan their next move.
meanings.sent4: The ravelin stood like a loyal guardian, shielding the fort from any impending danger.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight glinted off the ravelin, giving it an almost magical aura of protection.

meanings.sent1: She carefully began to ravelin the tangled threads of yarn to knit a new scarf.
meanings.sent2: It took hours to ravelin the mess of wires behind the entertainment center.
meanings.sent3: In a moment of frustration, he tried to ravelin the complicated plot of the mystery novel.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice seemed to ravelin the knots of tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze helped ravelin the sails of the boat, propelling it forward smoothly.
